newsitem.title: USA: U.S. issues SPR oil sale tender, bids due Oct 21.
newsitem.headline: U.S. issues SPR oil sale tender, bids due Oct 21.

text.p: The U.S. government issued a tender Thursday, as expected, offering up to 15 million barrels of light sour crude and 370,000 barrels of sweet crude from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, an Energy Department official said.
The first deadline for bids is Monday, October 21, and awards, if any, could be made later that week.

Congress required the Energy Department to sell $220 million worth of oil from the nation's emergency stockpile to cover the costs of running the reserve in the 1997 fiscal year, which began October 1.

The crude on offer would come from the SPR's West Hackberry, Louisiana site. Deliveries would be made by pipeline or tanker at the Sun Terminal at Nederland, Texas, or to the Texas Pipeline at Lake Charles, Louisiana.
